body:
##About:

A digital journalist with skills in data-driven investigation and visualisation, multimedia, SEO, SMO and journalism innovation. Favourite beats are Eastern European affairs, the media.

Graduating from MA Interactive Journalism at City University London in July 2015.

##Work experience

**Data Journalism Intern, the Bureau of Investigative Journalism** _(Apr. 2015)_ – London, UK

* Pitched and implemented data visualisations based on the Drone Wars datasets. Here is [my blog post showcasing the visualisations I've done for TBIJ](http://bit.ly/1dSCpg5).

**Data Journalism Intern, the MediaBriefing** _(Jan. 2015)_ – London, UK

* Analysed data scraped with BuzzSumo, produced visualisations, wrote [a follow-up story](http://bit.ly/Buzzsocial).
* Crowdsourced data about digital journalism in 11 Eastern European countries and wrote [a roundup](http://bit.ly/1DhWh4S).

**In-house Journalist at EPAM (NYSE:EPAM), IT Services** _(Apr. 2011 – Sep. 2014)_ – Minsk, Belarus

* Started data and video team within Marketing
* Full-cycle production of data visualisations and video (idea generation, internal data analysis (Excel), scriptwriting, project management, leading a team of designers/video editors). 
* Wrote news, features, conducted interviews for a house news website (in English). 
* Organised meetups and developed social presence for local IT communities.

Infographics/articles created for EPAM are available upon request (protected by corporate copyright). Video sample [here](http://bit.ly/grandhack14).

**Freelance Journalist, kyky.org** _(July 2012 - June 2013)_ – Minsk, Belarus

* Wrote features about technology, innovation, media for an online youth magazine.

**Literary Assistant, Peter R Cook** _(June – Sep. 2010)_ – Provincetown, MA, USA

* Conducted and wrote up interviews for an investigative documentary book and for a historical documentary film.

##Education

**MA Interactive Journalism, City University London** _(Sep. 2014 - July2015)_ | London, UK

* Data journalism, social media and engagement, online journalism, news, interviews and features, FOI, journalism innovation, media law, journalism ethics.
* Full scholarship provided by the Nordic Council of Ministers (ESSYB).

**Undergraduate Degree in Translation (English/German/Russian), Belarusian State University** _(Sep. 2006 – June 2011)_ – Minsk, Belarus

* GPA 92%. Thesis: Audiovisual Translation of Independent Cinema

##Skills

* **Data journalism**: FOI, advanced search, scraping (OutwitHub, Scraperwiki, R, Python), data cleaning and analysis (Excel, OpenRefine), data visualisation (Tableau, Google Fusion, DataWrapper, RAW, CartoDB, etc.).
* **Online journalism**: SEO, interactive tools, photo, video (Adobe Premiere/Final Cut Pro), audio, curation, UGC, liveblogging, Markdown, CMS (Wordpress, Adobe CQ, Drupal, Ghost).
* **Social media and engagement**: Google Analytics, SMO (variety of analytical tools), content for social.
* **Web development**: HTML | Version control: Github
* **Community building**: meetup/workshop organisation, mentoring
* Agile project management of distributed teams

**Languages**: English – Advanced+, German – Upper Intermediate, Ukrainian – Advanced, Russian and Belarusian – native.

##Projects, awards and volunteering

* Leader of **Hacks/Hackers Minsk** (since Jan 2014). [Find us on Facebook](http://bit.ly/hhminsk).

* Special Commendation Prizes at two hackathons, team formula – **Build The News 2 and 3** (Oct 2014, March 2015). Check our [Save-my-Spot](http://bit.ly/1MOvdga) and [SitRep](http://bit.ly/1GiXS8e) projects on GitHub.

* Volunteered at **International Journalism Festival** 2014 (Perugia); **MozFest** 2014, **Logan Symposium** 2014, **news:rewired** 2014 (London, UK).

* Workshop on data journalism at Hacks/Hackers Minsk (Jan 2014). Slideshare presentation [here](http://slidesha.re/1ufIBES). Wrote tutorials [sample here](http://bit.ly/GitHubjourno). Organised workshops on data journalism with Interhacktives (City University).

## Advanced training and fellowships

* Math for Journalists MOOC (June 2015) by Knight Center for Journalism in the Americas/University of Texas at Austin, online
* M100 YEJ Workshop (Data Journalism) by Sanssouci Colloquium (Sep. 2014), Potsdam, Germany
* Journalism for Future Challenges programme (investigative journalism) by OCCRP (May 2014), Riga, Latvia
* Data Journalism Bootcamp by UNDP and Open Knowledge Foundation (Nov. 2013), Chisinau, Moldova
* Data-driven Journalism MOOC (Aug. – Sep. 2013) by Knight Center for Journalism in the Americas
* Infographics and Data Visualization MOOC (Jan. – Feb. 2013) by Knight Center for Journalism in the Americas
